title: Thermodynamics Vocabulary
description: Master the vocabulary of heat, energy, and work with terms from the fascinating science of thermodynamics.

questions.question: What is 'thermodynamics'?
options: The branch of physics dealing with heat, work, temperature, and energy

questions.question: What does the 'First Law of Thermodynamics' state?
options: Energy cannot be created or destroyed, only transformed from one form to another
Heat always flows from cold to hot

questions.question: What is 'conduction'?
options: The transfer of heat through direct contact between materials
The conversion of heat to light

questions.question: What is 'convection'?
options: The creation of heat from friction
Heat transfer through the movement of fluids (liquids or gases)

questions.question: What is 'absolute zero'?
options: The boiling point of liquid nitrogen
The lowest possible temperature, where molecular motion theoretically ceases (0 Kelvin or -273.15 degrees Celsius)

questions.question: What does 'specific heat capacity' measure?
options: The boiling point of a liquid
The amount of heat energy required to raise the temperature of one unit of mass by one degree

questions.question: What is 'radiation' as a form of heat transfer?
options: The emission of energy as electromagnetic waves, which can travel through a vacuum

questions.question: What is 'enthalpy'?
options: A measure of the total heat content of a system

questions.question: What does an 'insulator' do?
options: Resists the flow of heat, keeping warm things warm and cold things cold

questions.question: What is 'thermal equilibrium'?
options: When all objects are at absolute zero
The state when two objects in contact reach the same temperature and heat no longer flows between them
When a liquid begins to boil

questions.question: What is a 'Joule'?
options: The SI unit of energy, work, or heat

questions.question: What does the 'Second Law of Thermodynamics' describe?
options: Pressure and volume are always equal
In any energy transfer, the total entropy of a system tends to increase over time
Heat flows from cold to hot naturally

questions.question: What is a 'heat engine'?
options: A device that converts thermal energy into mechanical work
A device that only produces heat

questions.question: What is 'latent heat'?
options: Heat that is visible as light
The heat absorbed or released during a phase change without a temperature change

questions.question: What is 'thermal conductivity'?
options: The color change of a heated object
A measure of how well a material conducts heat
The weight of a heated object
